item.text: For every high priest is taken from among the people and appointed to represent them before God, to offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins.

He is <st data-num="1410" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="3356">deal compassionately</st> with those who are <st data-num="50" class="">ignorant</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4105" class="">erring</st>, <st data-num="1893" class="">since</st> <st data-num="846" class="">he</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> is <st data-num="4029" class="">subject</st> to <st data-num="769" class="">weakness</st>,

<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1223">for</st> <st data-num="846">this reason</st> he is <st data-num="3784" class="">obligated</st> to <st data-num="4374" class="">make</st> <st data-num="266" class="">sin</st> <st data-num="4374" class="">offerings</st> <st data-num="4012" class="">for</st> <st data-num="846">himself</st> <st data-num="2531">as well as</st> <st data-num="4012" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="2992" class="">people</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">no</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">one</st> <st data-num="2983" class="">assumes</st> this <st data-num="5092" class="">honor</st><n id="1" /> on <st data-num="1438">his own initiative</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> only when <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st> to it <st data-num="5259" class="">by</st> <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="2531">as in fact</st> <st data-num="2" class="">Aaron</st> was.
So also Christ did not glorify himself in becoming high priest, but the one who glorified him was God, who said to him, “You are my Son! Today I have fathered you,”
as also in another place God says, “You are a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.”

<st data-num="1722" class="">During</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="4561" class="">earthly</st> <st data-num="2250">life</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="3739">Christ</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="4374" class="">offered</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="5037" class="">both</st> <st data-num="1162" class="">requests</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2428" class="">supplications</st>, <st data-num="3326" class="">with</st> <st data-num="2478" class="">loud</st> <st data-num="2906" class="">cries</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1144" class="">tears</st>, <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> the one who was <st data-num="1410" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="4982" class="">save</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> <st data-num="2288" class="">death</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> he was <st data-num="1522" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="575">because of</st> his <st data-num="2124" class="">devotion</st>.

<st data-num="2539" class="">Although</st> he <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> a <st data-num="5207" class="">son</st>, he <st data-num="3129" class="">learned</st> <st data-num="5218" class="">obedience</st> <st data-num="575" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="3739" class="">things</st> he <st data-num="3958" class="">suffered</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> by being <st data-num="5048" class="">perfected</st> in this way, he <st data-num="1096" class="">became</st> the <st data-num="159" class="">source</st> of <st data-num="166" class="">eternal</st> <st data-num="4991" class="">salvation</st> to <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st> who <st data-num="5219" class="">obey</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>,
and he was designated by God as high priest in the order of Melchizedek.
On this topic we have much to say, and it is difficult to explain, since you have become sluggish in hearing.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> though you <st data-num="3784" class="">should</st> in fact <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> <st data-num="1320" class="">teachers</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">by</st> this <st data-num="5550" class="">time</st>,<n id="1" /> you <st data-num="5532" class="">need</st> someone to <st data-num="1321" class="">teach</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> the <st data-num="746" class="">beginning</st> <st data-num="4747" class="">elements</st> of <st data-num="2316">God’s</st> <st data-num="3051" class="">utterances</st>.<n id="2" /> You have <st data-num="1096">gone back</st> to <st data-num="5532" class="">needing</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="1051" class="">milk</st>, <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="4731" class="">solid</st> <st data-num="5160" class="">food</st>.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">everyone</st> who <st data-num="3348" class="">lives</st> on <st data-num="1051" class="">milk</st> is <st data-num="552" class="">inexperienced</st> in the <st data-num="3056" class="">message</st> of <st data-num="1343" class="">righteousness</st> <st data-num="1063" class="">because</st> he <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> an <st data-num="3516" class="">infant</st>.
But solid food is for the mature, whose perceptions are trained by practice to discern both good and evil.
